subject: Languages
title: Ainu: Japan's Forgotten First Language
description: A micro-lesson that makes Ainu: Japan's Forgotten First Language usable.

hook.text: Japan has a hidden indigenous people. Their language has fewer than ten fluent speakers left.

buildup.text: The Ainu are the original inhabitants of northern Japan, predating the Japanese by thousands of years.

discovery.text: Ainu is a language isolate â€” unrelated to Japanese or any other known language family.

twist.text: Japan forced Ainu children into Japanese schools and denied Ainu identity until 2008.

climax.text: Young Ainu activists are now learning the language from elderly speakers before it's too late.

punchline.text: Japan's oldest language is its most endangered. The clock is nearly out.

quiz.question: What is unusual about the Ainu language?
options: It's a language isolate with no known relatives
